required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BLOOM: Behavioral Modification and Lorcaserin for Overweight and Obesity Management
clinical_study.official_title: BLOOM: Behavioral Modification and Lorcaserin for Overweight and Obesity Management; A 104-Week, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of Lorcaserin Hydrochloride in Obese Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the weight loss effect of lorcaserin at the end of the first year of treatment (Week 52) and to assess the ability of lorcaserin to maintain weight loss at the end of the second year of treatment (Week 104)

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Year 1: Co-Primary Endpoint- Proportion (%) of Patients Achieving > or = 5% Weight Loss From Baseline to Week 52
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients with a reduction from baseline body weight of 5% or more at the end of year 1. Other co-primary endpoints are change from baseline in body weight (kg) at year 1 and the proportion of patients achieving â‰¥ 10% reduction in body weight at year 1.

primary_outcome.measure: Year 2: Proportion (%) of Patients Maintaining > or = 5% Weight Loss at Week 104
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients with a reduction from baseline body weight of 5% or more at the end of year 1 and who maintained this reduction during year 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Year 1: Percent Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Year 1: The % change in body weight (kg) from baseline to week 52.

secondary_outcome.measure: Year 2: Percent Change in Body Weight From Week 52 to Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Year 2: The % change in body weight (kg) from week 52 to week 104.

arm_group.description: Lorcaserin 10 mg tablet each morning and evening
Matching placebo tablet each morning and evening

intervention.description: Lorcaserin 10 mg tablet each morning and evening for a duration of 52 or 104 weeks.
Matching placebo tablet each morning and evening for a duration of 52 or 104 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Obese adults with a BMI 30 to 45 kg/m2 or overweight adults with a BMI 27 to 29.9 kg/m2 and at least one obesity-related comorbidity (hypertension, dyslipidemia, cardiovascular disease, glucose intolerance, sleep apnea)
- Ability to complete a 2 year study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes
- Pregnancy
- History of heart valve disease
- Serious or unstable current or past medical conditions

overall_official.affiliation: MedStar Health Research Institute, Georgetown University

group.title: Year 2 - Lorc 10 mg BID (Yr 1) / Lorc 10 mg BID (Yr 2)
group.description: Patients were randomized to lorcaserin in Year 1, completed year 1 study and randomized to lorcaserin in Year 2.

group.title: Year 2 - Lorc 10 mg BID (Yr 1) / Placebo (Yr 2)
group.description: Patients were randomized to lorcaserin in Year 1, completed year 1 study and randomized to placebo in Year 2.

group.title: Year 2 - Placebo (Yr 1) / Placebo (Yr 2)
group.description: Patients randomized to placebo in Year 1, completed year 1 and randomized to receive placebo in Year 2.

outcome.description: The proportion of patients with a reduction from baseline body weight of 5% or more at the end of year 1. Other co-primary endpoints are change from baseline in body weight (kg) at year 1 and the proportion of patients achieving â‰¥ 10% reduction in body weight at year 1.

outcome.title: Year 2: Proportion (%) of Patients Maintaining > or = 5% Weight Loss at Week 104
outcome.description: The proportion of patients with a reduction from baseline body weight of 5% or more at the end of year 1 and who maintained this reduction during year 2.

group.description: Patients were randomized to lorcaserin in Year 1, completed year 1 study with a "Responder" status and randomized to lorcaserin in Year 2.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data was collected for a period of up to 2 years. The data is separated by group and by year and is inclusive for each year.

group.title: Year 2 - Lorc 10 mg BID (Yr 1) / Lorc 10 mg BID (Yr 2)
Year 2 - Lorc 10 mg BID (Yr 1) / Matching Placebo (Yr 2)
group.description: lorcaserin 10 mg BID tablets, matching placebo tablets

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Publication of study results are only allowed with prior written consent from Arena Pharmaceuticals, Inc.
